content:
First, I don't have a solution on why Thunderbird disappeared. So, my suggestion is to check your Windows account. You mentioned being the 'second user' and my thought is that you are logging into PC with your son's account and not yours. Managing multiple setups on Windows I have never done, but that seems a possibility.

Question: Is Thunderbird now working with a new profile? Please give status on your situation.
creator: davidsk

content: Are you downloading from https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/ ? Try downloading from this site. Once downloaded, click to install and it will automatically create an empty profile for you.
creator: davidsk

content: My first suggestion is to review the settings carefully on the phone, as it may be that your PC is not setup the same way. The 'not connecting' message indicates that the server name or port number may be wrong.
creator: davidsk

content: FIRST, please STOP creating new posts for every response. Keep this message in your inbox and reply with it. That will keep the messages together. Since you made no changes, my guess is that Norton antivirus may be interfering. There are settings in Norton that let it not interfere with email settings. Since you have posted this problem in the past, this could be a part of that. I do not know what you mean by a Google antivirus, but two antivirus programs is one too many. Desirable screenshots (which may not be needed if the antivirus is the cause) are - click account settings, then server settings. That screenshot would show info on incoming server - click account settings, scroll down left side to 'Outgoing Server (SMTP) and click your outgoing server. That screenshot will provide info on how you are set up for sending.
creator: davidsk

content: I discovered the problem: I usually prefer to look at the "All mail" view of Gmail on my phone. This (evidently) doesn't properly reflect the deleted status from Thunderbird (and perhaps from Gmail as well).
